titles.title: Selective Service Standby Act of 1993

To amend the Military Selective Service Act to terminate the registration requirement and to terminate the activities of civilian local boards, civilian appeal boards and similar local agencies of the Selective Service System.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Military Forces and Personnel.

bill.summary: 11/22/1993--Introduced. Selective Service Standby Act of 1993 - Amends the Military Selective Service Act to prohibit: (1) requiring a person to submit to registration under the Selective Service System (SSS); (2) the President from appointing a person as a member of a civilian local board, civilian appeal board, or similar local agency of the SSS; and (3) any such board from meeting. Prohibits a person from being denied any right, privilege, benefit, or employment position under Federal law by reason of failure to so register after such date.
